title: Fix uploaded photo not loading in celebration view

requirements.text: Fix the celebration view so the final uploaded photo reliably loads from static assets, using a valid file path under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (and matching the actual filename and extension) rather than a broken/missing reference.

quotes: The photo is not loading. Please check.

acceptanceCriteria: After clicking “Yes”, the celebration view renders the final photo without a broken-image icon on a fresh load (hard refresh).
The photo is served as a static public asset (no backend calls) and the `src` path resolves to an existing file under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.

requirements.text: Add graceful error handling for the final photo in the celebration view: if the photo cannot be loaded, show a small English fallback message in the UI (and avoid layout breaking), and log a clear console warning indicating the missing/failed image path.

quotes: The photo is not loading. Please check.

acceptanceCriteria: If the photo fails to load, the UI shows an English fallback message (e.g., “Photo failed to load.”) in place of the image and the rest of the celebration view remains usable.
The browser console includes a clear warning identifying the failed image URL/path when the image load fails.

constraints: Do not fetch the uploaded photo from the backend; it must remain a static frontend asset served from `frontend/public/`.
Do not modify any files under the immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Implementing a new photo upload flow or storing user photos in the backend.
Adding Internet Identity or any authentication-gated photo access.
